comment: 100% recommend, the class is very easy and informative. There's a textbook but it's free and he posts powerpoint slides of chapters. Easy discussion assignments due before classes as well as short quizzes and occasional papers and tests. He's very kind and you can tell loves sociology, his lectures are fun and he tells stories to tie concepts in.
He is a great professor has a funny and caring personality. If you take the class in person it's easy he makes it fun and the work isn't hard.

The best part of this class is great lectures, content, and discussion, as well as open note tests, he is an experienced sociologist with good insight, but he is so unorganized. MESSY deadlines and grading, always changes deadlines and assignments and doesn't communicate well. Still, its overall fairly easy, and you'll learn a lot. Great guy.

If Mr. Johnson is available, take his class! This class was super easy and as long as you do everything thats required you will pass, I made 100's-80 (80's because I forgot to respond on two) on every discussion. There are writing assignments and quizzes, they take no more than 40 minutes. The final was the only low grade I got due to lateness.

Dr. Johnson is definitely one of the best professors here at KSU! I took him 3 times, and all 3 times were great. He has a great personality, and his lectures are awesome! You can easily tell he has a passion for sociology. His classes were never difficult. Just do your work, which is not a whole lot, and you'll get an A!

The content isn't bad, but the professor is wildly inconsistent and unorganized. The due dates on the syllabus are not aligned with what is posted. 3 tests, weekly discussion posts and weekly quizzes. You have 2 essays which are extremely easy. If you need something easy and aren't bothered by unorganized classes, I say do it.

If you're planning on taking this class online, just don't. He doesn't communicate at all with his students unless you email him, his rubric is all over the place, and he provides no explanation to changing the due dates. Despite all of this, his class is still easy, all you have to do is to do everything 5 days ahead of time to avoid penalties.

Johnson was a great professor, his lectures were insightful and engaging, and he pushes for class discussion. If i'm not mistaken he provided a free textbook. Course Structure: Discussion Posts, Quizzes, and Tests (no camera for both). This class is very easy, you just have to think for yourself.

Dr Johnson can make classes sometimes funny, since it is a boring subject for most. The textbook is free so you don't have to worry. There's weekly discussion posts and both quizzes/tests are take home. The class can get a little repetitive since there is nothing much besides lectures. He actively asks questions to keep us engaged as well.

Dr. Johnson is a good professor. Lectures are decently interesting and test aren't too hard. The only thing about this class is attendance is mandatory as it is 25% of your grade, you had to attend 25/30 classes to get full credit but each class after 25 you got an extra point added to your grade.

Took Soci1101 online, super easy class. Prof. Johnson is easy to communicate with and is always open for questions and concerns. Interesting class material and gives good resources. Would definitely take his class again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: This is the one class I'm taking that has many discussion posts, a few quizzes, and 3 papers, but when I tell you I would take it 100 times again, I would! Best professor by far. Just make sure you submit everything on time. He responds back to emails no matter how many times you email him. 10/10, very patient, and I highly recommend Best professor

Johnson is a great man! There were only 3 or 4 tests throughout the semester & the textbook was free and could be used during them. I didn't rate his teaching 5 stars because even though class discussion was huge (which I love), it wasn't engaging, so I found myself zoned out a lot. But I learned things that I'll be taking with me!

This was my 1st time taking Dr. W and I would take him again. I personally don't enjoy online courses because professors will make you learn the material yourself & provide no help, & it can be a few more assignments. however, Dr. W's online course was laid out well, weekly discussions, & one week you'll either write a paper (8) or  take a test (8)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: I would hesitate to recommend taking his class due to the lack of engagement. The class only has four tests throughout the entire semester, but attendance is mandatory as it is factored into your final grade. The lectures can be dull, but the professor is knowledgeable and well-respected."

Professor Johnsons' class is not difficult, as long as you read the textbook chapters you will be able to pass this class. The tests are not difficult, and most of the coursework is discussions and quizzes. I would recommend this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: A great professor. He isn't a harsh grader at all. This was my favorite elective that i've taken so far. Work isn't hard at all.

Ok professor, but there were issues I had with the amount of work required every week. There were 2 discussion posts and 2 quizzes due each week as well as an essay due every other week. Very lengthy with lengthy responses to others required. I found my week was taken up by just sociology rather than my other major classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Overall, Johnson is a very caring and respectable professor. Attendance is mandatory with credit, so be prepared to come to class. Daily lectures, 2 weekly quizzes (no lockdown) and discussions with replies. All tests are online and easy as long as you pay attention during class. You definitely have to put in work for your grade in this class.

Take him if you want an easy A!!! His grades consisted of weekly 2 quizzes and 2 discussion posts (250 words minimum and must reply to 2 others). There is a textbook you must read but it shouldn't be a challenge! Make sure you submit it on time cause he will deduct points. Tests and quizzes don't require lockdown browsers or webcams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Be prepared to have to come to class. He gives attendance as credit. Lectures are mostly PowerPoints, videos, discussions. If you are passionate about learning about crime, his class is for you as he asks a lot about your opinion. However, if you are using this class to just receive a grade, may not be that interesting to you.

The professor is kind and passionate about course materials and discussion. Please be careful about topics the professor mentions multiple times, as it is important to assignments, discussions, and tests. He does not offer comprehensive study guides but will outline what to focus on to prepare for tests. There were weekly assignments/discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Weird structure for the class. He would do slides sometimes but then switch to the textbook and jumped around with whatever he was talking about. Eventually so many students just stopped showing up because they realized that he just read straight from the textbook and they could do that from home.

An easy class, all you have to do is make sure you read the textbook and write and respond to the discussion posts. Just make sure you cite your sources. The quizzes are super easy and not in lockdown.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: A WEEK includes 2 discussion posts 2 peer responses (total of 4) & 2 quizzes. Throughout the semester, there'll be 2 weeks with two quizzes 2 discussion postings & an essay due. He doesn't grade too forgivingly. Although the topic may be simple thus far, don't take this class if you have a lot of outside commitments like work or family etc.

Dr. Johnson provides clear grading criteria, respected and equally respectful toward his students. Kind, and gives great feedback. He keeps the course engaging. Very responsive. This was a 4 week online course, no lockdown browser, book is a MUST. Weekly assign. and discussions. Take him, you will not regret it! He cares about students learning.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is such an easy professor, all he wants is students to be engaged in what he is teaching so participation is something that he looks for. His quizzes and exams are all found on quizlet.

Take him!!!! This was one of the classes that I really enjoyed this year, and it touches on many life subjects. Time felt like it would go by fast in his class and he truly seems passionate about teaching. Discussions post almost once every week, but they are easy.

The class is really easy, there is no way you can't get an A. However, he goes off on random tangents that sometimes have nothing to do with the lesson and he is very sarcastic, which made him come off as passive aggressive. His grades off 12 discussions, 10 quizzes, and 3 tests which are all easy and straight forward.

Such an amazing professor. He is so caring and wants you to participate in class. Attendance is mandatory, but you can miss class up to 3 times. You have a discussion post every week, except test weeks. A few quizzes. Tests and quizzes are open note and super easy.  Take him if you can, sweetest teacher ever.

Dr. Wendell Johnson and his Sociology of Violence class were by far some of my favorite experiences at KSU. He was amazing when it came to facilitating lectures and the lectures were always both insightful and interesting. He has a long and extensive background in the field of Sociology and has a great deal of experience upon the subjects covered.

By far one of the best professors at Kennesaw. He makes learning about sociology so exciting. Youre graded on a discussion and quiz a week (some weeks you dont have one or the other) and 3 tests. The textbook is online and not needed. Professor Johnson makes lectures enjoyable and is overall such a nice guy

Dr. Johnson is one of the classes I took my time at Kennesaw. He made me want to learn more and encouraged me to grasp as much information I could retain. I was never bored, and I will retake him for another class in my future semesters!

Honestly one of the best classes I've taken. 3 tests, about 10-12 discussions, and weekly quizzes. He genuinely wants you to gain something from this course even if it may be easy. If you can take sociology with him do it.

Weekly discussion posts (1 or 2) and weekly quizzes (1 or 2) - open book. Tests are open book. Fairly easy class, everything is written out clearly. 2 writing assignments which are super easy. Great professor and very caring. Everything is on quizlet. Quizzes & tests are easy, basically straight from the book. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN

10 discussion posts, 3 tests, and 10 quizzes are all the work for the semester. The professor is very entertaining. Make sure you read the syllabus because for my class you couldn't miss more than three classes in order to receive participation points.
Easy online class. 1-2 discussion post a week along with a quiz, very doable and easy. Also 3 tests and two easy essays. He is an easy grader as long as you turn thing in on time.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Johnson was an awesome professor. While there chapters had a good bit of info to read, the discussion posts are engaging and arent too bad to write (minimum 250 word count is easily reached). The quizzes are non lockdown, and arent too bad. The same goes for the tests. The lowest I scored on a text was a 95% and that was because I misclicked.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Johnson was kind of a rambler which made it hard to sit through class. A lot of the time the lecture wasnt relevant to material, but attendance is mandatory. Easy assignments though- and no research paper. He does a ppt project instead which is far easier. 1 writing assignment each week, 5 discussion posts, 3 tests.

Highly recommend to take this professor! There is usually 1 quiz and 1 discussion per week, but the discussion is normally just asking for your opinion on something and the quiz is straight from the textbook (which is free). Tests are easy. Nothing is on lockdown browser, and he is also available outside of class hours to help. 100/10 professor!

I love Dr. Johnson. He is very sweet and enjoys hearing your opinions. He asks very little of students compared to other professors. Do your work and you will pass. He can get off topic sometimes but it doesn't really matter if you are doing your work outside of class. Very textbook based so read it ! Can't wait to take him again !
all quizzes and tests are on quizlet, 2 discussion boards and 2 quizzes a week, but super simple stuff. finished with an A. would 100% take again
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great guy! He was a harsher grader in the beginning of the semester but he turned pretty laid-back in the end. You usually have 2 quizzes and 2 discussion posts every week. Always use quizlet. I took him online so I rarely interacted with him but when I did he always took my concerns seriously and was very nice. Take him!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This man is a king. He is so funny and makes class interesting with multiple examples and videos. All tests are open book and there are not many. He is very willing to work with you if you miss an assignment. This was probably the most laid back class I have ever had in my life. I would recommend this class to literally anyone. He's the best choice

Highly recommend taking his class, you will do a discussion a week, as well as take 9 quizzes, and 4 test online that arent lockdown. The discussion can get tedious after a while, because he does look for content in your post and response. Also attendance is mandatory, but you dont have to pay attention in class to pass just use Socratic.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: If you're looking for an easy A course, TAKE HIM. Weekly discussions that are really just asking for your opinion, a few easy quizzes, and 3 exams. All assignments are online. He is big on attendance which is annoying but again, easy points just for showing up. He calls on people randomly during class to read so beware. You dont need the textbook

Dr. Johnson was amazing; he has a very charismatic personality and overall is a great professor that knows how to keep his students engaged with every lesson. The textbook can be found online and he will post it in his D2L so need to purchase it. Although attendance is not mandatory it is part of your grade. would take again!

Theres 3-4 easy discussion questions all semester. Tests (online) are moderate, no lockdown browser. Dont have to buy a book. There is a research paper, its split into 3 different sections which youll get a grade on each of them. Sometimes we watch videos instead of taking notes. Can sometimes go too in-depth. Overall a good teacher

This class was not difficult but I disliked the lectures. He would always go off topic and discuss what he wanted to discuss. He gave a 3 part research paper, 2 online quizzes, and 3 online tests. If you read the free, online textbook and any other resources he sends, they're all an easy A. He rarely answers emails and always takes attendence.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: This man is really sweet and cute. Understands the struggle of showing up to class. There's a 3 part paper, 4 tests, no final or midterm, 2 quizzes and some discussion posts. Super chill, just do your work and its all good. Really lenient in grading, just participate.

Loved taking them over the summer for online. Learned a great deal about myself in this short span. Very easy class and a very easy going professor. He even allowed me to redo a paper that I didn't turn in on time and allowed me to get the points I needed to get an A. Keep up with the due dates and make sure you're responding.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: AWESOME professor! Easy A. 4 essays and one quiz and 2 discussions posts a week with 2 replies per each post. Seems like a lot of work but he is a very easy grader and gives A's on all essays. Make sure you reach the word count for the discussion posts and essays though! Easy tests and quizzes! Take him! The average grade in the class was a 92-98!

If I had the opportunity to take this class again I would. If you're looking for the easiest class you have ever taken, this is it. The bad reviews are just people who couldn't do their work and submitted late. Every single thing is on quizlet and there are only 4 short essays. I got 100% on every essay which doesn't happen. TAKE THIS CLASS!
All answers on quizlet to quizzes. Weekly discussion post. 3 short essays. TAKE HIM!!!!!! You will not regret it.
All the tests and quizzes are on Quizlet! 2 discussion posts and 2 quizzes each week and two easy papers.

This online class requires two weekly quizzes, two weekly discussion posts online, and two short essays in total. The discussions and quizzes take 2 hours total at a maximum each week. It's a guaranteed A if you turn in the work. The 3 online tests are similar to quizzes, no cumulative final. Prof is accessible by email if you need assistance.

He is such a great teacher. He will make the class interact with each other and he will never just read off the powerpoints. He wants you to try to understand everything as much as possible and asks his students questions. You sign in every class to get extra points at the end of the semester. Easy A.

Dr. Johnson is one of the nicest professors I've had at KSU. He is very light-hearted and personal with his students and doesn't make the class harder than it needs to be. 4 online tests, 1 critique paper, and extra credit if you don't miss too many classes. The textbook he uses is free online and he makes sure that no one fails his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He gave us four online tests that were taken outside of class (he canceled class on test days) and one critique where you just had to read a paper and answer the questions on it. He was enthusiastic and pretty funny.

He is funny and kind. He loves to lecture and get the class to participate in it. He will often call names off of the attendance sheet if nobody responds. The tests are easy, online, and he prepares you for them well. Attendance is taken and if you miss few classes he will give you extra credit.

Dr. Johnson gives four tests total, and one critique. The tests are all online and there is no weblock. Attendance is required, but you usually get extra credit for it. The test questions come straight from the practice questions in the book and from the notes. He is funny, kind, and understanding.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Johnson was a great professor. He makes you think and likes participation. There was no final. We had a writing assignment that wasn't explained very well, but he always answers questions after class. He loves his job, and tries to learn the names of the students in lecture. There were 3 tests and they were all online, so you could use notes.

I took this online and this is the easiest A I've ever gotten. The info is interesting and it brought up my gpa a little. QUIZLET HELPS ON EVERYTHING. I REPEAT, QUIZLET HELPS ON EVERYTHING. sorry I didn't want to yell.

This is the second class I have taken with Dr. Johnson, and this one is much easier. Got A's on all quizzes. Discussion posts every week that take a little bit of time, but are easy. Two papers that are overall easy. This class is much easier than the sociology of violence course I took with him.

I think this may have been Dr. Johnson's first time teaching sociology of violence. Although there are no "tests", there are 5 quizzes that are pretty difficult. The best I did on the quizzes the whole semester was an 82. Luckily, there are a ton of written assignments & discussion posts and a paper that brought my grade up to an A. It wasn't easy!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tests are tough

comment: Professor Johnson is a fantastic educator! His class is heavy on lecture, so attendance is important, but the way he lectures is engaging and he makes the topics very interesting. He is very compassionate and cares about his students. If you're looking for a great professor for Intro to Sociology, take him! I'd take his class again in a heartbeat!

Such a great professor! He really tries to connect with his students and he makes great lectures. There's 4 essays each pretty simple. 3 tests and the last of those tests was the final. So glad I took him!

Professor Johnson is probably the best professor I've had at KSU. He cares about his students and has a great sense of humor! You have 4 tests that are all an easy A if you simply go to class and take notes from his powerpoint's (4th test is the final) and 4 essays that are also very easy!! Would DEFINITELY take again!! TAKE HIM!!!!
he was one of the best online teachers i have had! tells you everything that needs to be done. online quizzes and 3 online exams with weekly discussion posts. Easy A!

Professor Johnson is awesome. He is easy, but knowledgeable at the same time. You don't need to buy the textbook. If you show up to class, you will make an A on all of the tests. There are a few essays and then one critique at the end of class. He is caring and wants you to succeed. His lectures are interesting and engaging.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring
